item.title: Issue #2084 created
item.description:
Steps when the context value contains multiple nodes

We have two conflicting statements in the spec.

ยง4.6.4 says: "The step expression S is equivalent to ./S. Thus, if the context value is a sequence containing multiple nodes, the semantics of a step expression are equivalent to a path expression in which the step is always applied to a single node."

ยง4.6.5 says: "When the context value for evaluation of a step includes multiple nodes, the step is evaluated separately for each of those nodes, and the results are combined without reordering."

I'm not sure which is intended: does S means. / S, or . ! S?
